sys_metadata_link.payload:
73f34d689722111085acbbc3f153af3c 1970-01-02 06:00:00
1. Heat the oven (two-sided heat: 200 °C / 392 F)
2. Either half the pumpkin or remove the lit by cutting around 4cm
3. Remove the inner parts of the pumpkin with a big spoon
4. Add some olive oil to the pumpkin (inside and outside)
5. Put the pumpkin into the oven for around 20 minutes (depening on pumpkin size can be longer)
6. Cut the onions and the garlic into small pieces / very small cubes.
7. Put a pan on the stove and heat the pine nuts until they are roasted
8. Remove the pine nuts from the pan
9. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pan
10. Add the onions and around 5 minutes later the garlic
11. Add the spinach
12. If frozen wait until it gets more fluid. If real spinach is used wait until it is collapsed
13. Add the riccotta or creme fraiche
14. Add salt, pepper, thyme and nutmeg
15. Add one third of the mozzarella and the pine nuts
16. Fill everything from the pan into the pumpkin
17. Put the last two thirds of mozzarella on top and bake until a brown crust forms
]]> false
  • Servings: 2
  • Prep time: 20 Hours
  • Cook time: 1 Day 6 Hours
  • Total time: 2 Days 2 Hours
    • ]]>
    • 1 Hokkaido-Pumpkin, around 1 kg
    • 400g Baby-Spinach (can also be frozen young spinach which is already cut)
    • dry thyme
    • 1 Onion
    • 2 Gloves of Garlic
    • 20g Pine nuts
    • 250g Pasta
    • 2 tablespoons olive oil
    • 150g Ricotta or Créme fraiche
    • 1 take of salt
    • 1 take of pepper
    • 1 take of nutmeg
